Risk for genetic disorders and teratogenic exposure 
The following are risk factors for congenital disorders: 
• mother aged 37 years or more at conception
• alcohol and recreational drug and smoking use by the mother
• a child conceived of a consanguineous relationship
• a family history of genetic disorders
